greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{ d divides n } tau(gcd(d,n/d)), where tau = sigma_0 = A000005.
comment: Apparently the Mobius transform of A046951. - _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 07 2011
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
L. Tóth, Multiplicative arithmetic functions of several variables: a survey, arXiv preprint arXiv:1310.7053 [math.NT], 2013.
formula: a(p) = 2 iff p is a prime.
Multiplicative with a(p^e) = e+1+floor(e^2/4). - _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 14 2011
Dirichlet g.f.: zeta(s)^2 * zeta(2*s). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 11 2019
maple: A124315 := proc(n) local a,d; a := 0 ; for d in numtheory[divisors](n) do igcd(d,n/d) ; a := a+numtheory[tau](%) ; end do: a; end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 14 2011
program: (PARI) a(n) = sumdiv(n, d, numdiv(gcd(d, n/d))); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 12 2016
from sympy import divisors, divisor_count, gcd
def a(n): return sum([divisor_count(gcd(d, n/d)) for d in divisors(n)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 25 2017
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Sep 30 2006
